title: Shaws beats drum for Recce Pharma placement
text:
Synthetic antibiotics developer Recce Pharmaceuticals has tasked Shaw and Partners with raising fresh funds for the company on Tuesday.

Shaw was seeking buyers for 15.5 million new Recce shares at 26¢ each on Tuesday morning, in a placement to raise $4 million.

The deal was priced at a 17.5 per cent discount to the last close and a 20 per cent discount to the five day VWAP, according to terms sent to potential investors.

Funds raised were pegged for clinical trials.

Recce is as ASX-listed health company that told investors it is pioneering the development and commercialisation of a new class of synthetic antibiotics with broad spectrum activity designed to address the urgent global health problem of antibiotic resistant superbugs.

The company had a $33.7 million market capitalisation prior to the raising.

Shaw was calling for bids by 9am Perth time on Wednesday.
